column4: where is SWAT for Samba located in Ubuntu?  Or how do I find where it is?
can anyone help me get samba and SWAT working?
what exactly do you want to do?
I want to share files between my laptop (ubuntu), my ubuntu box, and both of my windows xp boxes
start with something simple like "sudo aptitude install samba". ;o)
swat is also a valid package that you can install with aptitude/synaptic/apt-get
got that too.  just can't figure out how to get SWAT to open up and let me start configuring my samba server
Try accessing http://localhost:901/ on your web browser, please.
Do you know if swat is started? I'm not sure if it runs as a daemon... Try "sudo ps xa | grep swat", please.
Ok, now please check if you can do something like "sudo invoke-rc.d swat start"
I'm sorry but I can't figure out what's going on with your swat installation... But what do you think about webmin-samba? :o)
I want to do whatever i have to in order to get samba working
Ok, I've just found something called "Shared Folders" under "System" / "Settings"
I believe it can manage Samba for you.
want to pm me?  It will be easer to read what eachother is saying
